title: Are the champ pools typically this stale in the LCS?
body: I haven't been playing too long and have been watching the LCS for even less. Today it seemed as though I was seeing Azir, Gragas, Annie, Rek, Rumble and Kalista like every match. Is it always like this?

replies.body:
These are what are supposed to the best picks if you want to win the game.
Top: Best: Mao'kai, Gnar (he's more popular in the Eastern regions though), Rumble, Hecarim, Ryze
Good: Irelia, Vlad, Fizz, Yasuo, Ekko
Jungle: Best: Gragas, Rek'sai
Good: Lee Sin, Sejuani, Evelynn, Nunu, Ekko
Mid: Best: Azir, LeBlanc, Kog'maw, Varus, Ekko
Good: Fizz, Cassiopeia
ADC: Best: Sivir, Kalista
Good: Corki, Vayne, Lucian, and obviously Draven
Support: Best: Alistar, Thresh, Nautilus
Good: Janna, Annie, Morgana

Here are the meta picks

Top: Fizz Maoki Gnar Rumble Vlad heciram 
Jungle : Sej Gragas Evelyn nunu Lee sin Reksia 
Mid : Azir Cass LB Zigs Varus Kogmaw
ADC :  Corki Vayne Sivir Kalista lucian 
Support : Alistar Naut Thresh Annie Morg ( don't get the annie and morg lately) yes i understand kalista annie

just in general order nothing specific. Probably missed some but thats the meta right now

You forgot sivir, maokai, hecarim, gnar, kog'maw, cassiopeia, varus, alistar. And yes it's pretty much always like this. It's the meta and has proven to be the most successful.

The only times you will see something interesting to watch is when Faker, UoL, or Keane (team gravity) plays.
LCS is always stale. if you want It to be phresh and exciting watch all regions. They all play so differently you forget how stale it is compared to just watching 1 region

>
> LCS is always stale. if you want It to be phresh and exciting watch all regions. They all play so differently you forget how stale it is compared to just watching 1 region

^ this also. NA LCS is the follower region. They don't innovate. they copy what other regions do

Most Regions only innovate rarely, which is why when worlds comes around you see the same 20-25ish champions picked or banned.

I think the most "innovative" region is China and Taiwan but that is because of the 44 games for each of the 12 teams (total of 264 for LPL) and the 21 Games for each of the 8 teams (total of 84 games for LMS)...for each split.

CN for Spring 2015 had 75 unique champion picks (which jumped to 95 with the playoffs)
KR had 67 (which jumped to 79 with the playoffs)
EU had 60 (which jumped to 68 with the playoffs)
NA had 55 (which jumped to 71 with the playoffs)
LMS had 77 (stayed at 77 through the playoffs)

All of this being said I agree with your statement below:
>this is probably the most diverse its been in a while
this is probably the most diverse its been in a while
